cube_structure_item.description: The counterparty’s probability of default over one year determined in accordance with Articles 160, 163, 179 and 180 of Regulation (EU) No 575/2013.

Aggregate amount of principal, interest and any fee payment outstanding at the reporting date, which is contractually due and has not been paid (past due). This amount is always to be reported. '0' is to be reported if the instrument was not past due on the reporting date.

The date on which the securities are delivered to the underwriter by the issuer against payment. This is the date when the securities are available for delivery to investors for the first time. Note: For a strip this column indicates the date on which the
The market value of an object.
The date on which an entity status as reported under “Entity status” came into effect according to par 5.4.22 of the Guidance note of the SHSG regulation
Nominal Value
The variable describes the unit in which the amount is reported
An identifier that uniquely identifies an issuer.

Flag indicating if an organisational unit is listed at any stock exchange (domestic or abroad) or its stocks are traded through an exchange; it can inversely be used to indicate the ‘delisting’ of an entity.
An identifier that uniquely identifies a guarantor.
Reference code in line with the International Organization for Standardization’s (ISO) 17442 standard

The date on which the instrument became past due in accordance with Part 2.48 of Annex V to Implementing Regulation (EU) No 680/2014. This is the latest such date prior to the reporting reference date and it is to be reported if the instrument is past due on the reporting reference date.

Reporting agents shall report credit data as recorded on the following reporting reference dates: (a) for monthly transmissions, on the last day of each month; (b) for quarterly transmissions, on the last day of March, June, September and December.
Loss given default (LGD) in normal economic times
Date on which the debt instrument is actually redeemed
An identifier to uniquely identify each security.
Exposure Value according to Regulation (EU) 575/2013, Article 111 Exposure value.
Risk-weight
The variable describes the status of the issuer, i.e. whether the issuer is alive (active) or not alive (not active).
The variable describes whether the instrument is guaranteed or not, its rank level and whether it is secured or not.
It defines the ‘security level’ whether an instrument is secured or unsecured, i.e. whether there is recourse to the cash flows of a securitised portfolio.
Exposure class according to Regulation (EU) 575/2013, Article 112 Exposure class.
From NCBs
The variable describes the unit of measure of the nominal value
The variable describes the status of the security, i.e. whether the issuer is alive or not alive.
The variable describes the type of identifier used as a Group ID, e.g. to specify that the RIAD code has been used for the Group ID.
Collateral geographical location
Loss given default (LGD) in downturns
The variable describes the type of identifier used as Issuer ID, e.g. to specify that the RIAD code has been used for the Immediate parent ID.
The carrying amount in accordance with Annex V to Implementing Regulation (EU) No 680/2014.
Balance sheet recognition of the financial asset.
Identification of forborne and renegotiated instruments.
Classification of exposures in the trading book as defined in Article 4(1)(86) of Regulation (EU) No 575/2013.

Type of transaction in which the exposure is encumbered in accordance with Implementing Regulation (EU) No 680/2014. An asset will be treated as encumbered if it has been pledged or if it is subject to any form of arrangement to secure, collateralise or credit enhance any instrument from which it cannot be freely withdrawn.
Type of impairment recorded in accordance with the accounting standard – IFRS or national GAAP.
Classification of the instrument according to the type of contractual terms agreed between the parties.
Guarantor ID type
Performing status in accordance with Implementing Regulation (EU) No 680/2014.
Full legal name of the counterparty acting in the role of issuer of securities
Indicates the Date at which the Security Status has changed from alive to not-alive
Frequency of reporting due, if any.
Area where the securities issuer is located. This is a union of countries and international organisations
It defines the security  ‘rank level’  how the instrument ranks in case of liquidation relatively compared to other instruments issued by the same issuer.
Currency denomination of instruments, in accordance with the ISO’s 4217 standard
The variable provides additional information on the status of the issuer, e.g. reasons for not being alive anymore.
Institutional sectors in accordance with Regulation (EU) No 549/2013, Regulation (EU) No 575/2013 and Regulation (EU) No 1075/2013 of the European Central Bank (ECB/2013/40)(1).
Default status of the issuer
It defines the security ‘guarantee level’  whether the instrument is guaranteed by an entity different from the issuer, e.g. by the government.
The variable describes the currency of the unit in which the amount is reported
The date on which a forbearance or renegotiation status as reported under 'status of forbearance and renegotiation' is considered to have occurred.
The variable provides additional information on the security status
Codification type for the security
The date on which the performing status is considered to have been established or changed.

The amount of loss allowances that are held against or are allocated to the instrument on the reporting reference date. This data attribute applies to instruments subject to impairment under the applied accounting standard. Under IFRS, the accumulated impairment relates to the following
amounts:
(i) loss allowance at an amount equal to 12-month expected
credit losses;
(ii) loss allowance at an amount equal to lifetime expected
credit losses.
Under GAAP, the accumulated impairment relates to the following
amounts:
(i) loss allowance at an amount equal to general allowances;
(ii) loss allowance at an amount equal to specific allowances.
The variable describes the entity ID type

Accounting portfolio where the instrument is recorded in accordance with the accounting standard – IFRS or national GAAP –under Regulation (EU) 2015/534 (ECB/2015/13) applied by the observed agent's legal entity.
Type of asset provided as security.
Date of the default status of the issuer
NA
The variable describes the currency of the nominal value

Classification of counterparties according to their economic activities, in accordance with the NACE revision 2 statistical classification as laid down in Regulation (EC) No 1893/2006 of the European Parliament and of the Council.
Classification of [Original maturity in days] according to a set of predefined periods.
Default status of the instrument
Reporting agent group identifier
INSTTTNL_SCTR_ISSR

In accordance with Article 107 of the CRR, Approach to which Standardized Approach provided for in Chapter 2 or, if permitted by the competent authorities in accordance with Article 143, the Internal Ratings Based Approach provided for in Chapter 3 to calculate their risk-weighted exposure amounts for the purposes of points (a) and (f) of Article 92(3).
Accumulated changes in fair value due to credit risk in accordance with Part 2.46 of Annex V to Implementing Regulation (EU) No 680/2014.
Truncated primary asset classification
Institutional sector control according to the subsectors defined in ESA 2010 Chapter 2 (private, public, …)
The total amount recovered since the date of default.
Currency of transaction reported
The method by which the impairment is assessed, if the instrument is subject to impairment in accordance with applied accounting standards. Collective and individual methods are distinguished.
Date of the default status of the instrument
Reporting agent legal entity identifier
The variable indicates whether early redemptions are included in the amount
The variable indicates whether the issuer is part of the Group for prudential scope
The variable indicates whether the issuer is part of the Group for accounting scope
The variable indicates whether interests were accrued for market value
